p: Norway rat is a domestic rodent whose lifestyle differs greatly from those of wild rodents. Norway rat lives in residential areas and feeds on various food items from humans instead of field crops [ 55]. Food resources and habitats are relatively stable and change only slightly with climate variability. Additionally, Norway rats breed throughout the year in Huludao City, where the winter temperatures rarely drop below −10 °C and residential areas have warmer conditions because of the winter heating policy in China. Winter breeding of wild rodents is limited because of low temperatures [ 56].
